verses.text: 葡萄樹的比喻耶和華的話臨到我說：

words.note: Often refers to Jesus' parables or similar metaphors in the Bible.
The covenant name of God in the Old Testament.
Often used in religious contexts for divine communication.

verses.text: 「人子啊！葡萄樹的木料怎能勝過樹林中的枝子呢？

words.note: A messianic title, here referring to Ezekiel as a prophet.

words.definition: to surpass, to be superior to

verses.text: 人可以從葡萄樹上取木料製造物件嗎？可以從葡萄樹上取木料做釘子掛器皿嗎？
看哪！已經拋在火裡當作燃料，火既燒毀了兩端，連中間也燒焦了，它還可以用來製造物件嗎？

words.note: A common interjection in biblical texts, drawing attention.

words.definition: to treat as, to regard as
to burn down, to destroy by fire

verses.text: 看哪！它完整的時候，尚且不能用來製造物件，何況它被火燒毀和燒焦了，它還能用來做甚麼呢？」

words.note: A common interjection in biblical texts, drawing attention.
Often used to emphasize an unexpected or lesser case.
Used to introduce an even more extreme or obvious situation.

words.definition: to burn down, to destroy by fire

verses.text: 因此，主耶和華這樣說：「我怎樣把樹林中的葡萄樹拋在火裡當作燃料，也必照樣對待耶路撒冷的居民。

words.note: Here refers to God, the Lord.
Indicates the following noun is the object of the verb.

verses.text: 我必變臉攻擊他們；他們雖然從火裡逃出來，火仍要吞滅他們；我變臉攻擊他們的時候，你們就知道我是耶和華。

words.note: Lit. 'change face', here implies turning in wrath.
Often used for complete destruction or consumption.
Lit. 'change face', here implies turning in wrath.
Used here to form an adverbial phrase 'when I turn against them'.

verses.text: 我必使這地荒涼，因為他們行了不忠的事。這是主耶和華的宣告。」

words.note: Refers to spiritual unfaithfulness, breaking covenant.
Here refers to God, the Lord.
